answers.answer: Drastically variable blood sugar levels as in diabetes can cause variable poor vision.Vision adaptation to the dark decreases with age.You should get your eyes examined by an ophthalmologist (eye specialist) to determine if there are any other reasons for your vision changes.

question: Some 3 years ago I had no appetite and I was given some tablets to boost my food intake.  One of the side effects was to boost sugar levels.  I didn't know this and after about a week I couldn't see clearly.  I thought that may be there was fog.  I went to the phamacy and they asked me if I had had a sugar check in my blood.  I was ok before so when they checked the levels were so high that they told me to go straight to hospital where I was detained for a week.  Ever since I can't see in the dark especially when I go to Africa for holiday.  Is there anyway my vision can be treated?  I have had checks since then but my sugar levels are normal and they concluded that it was the medicine I used to take that boosted these sugar levels.
title: Night vision
